And the word of the LORD came upon me, saying, You have shed much blood and have made great wars; you shall not build a house for My name, because you have shed many bloods on the earth in My sight.

Behold, a son shall be born to you; he shall be a man of rest, and I will give him rest from all his enemies round about. For Solomon shall be his name, and I will grant peace and quietness to Israel in his days.
He shall build a house for My name, and he shall be to Me a son, and I will be to him a father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.
Now, my son, may the LORD be with you, and may you prosper and build the house of the LORD your God, as He has spoken concerning you.
Only may the LORD give you wisdom and understanding, and give you charge over Israel, to keep the law of the LORD your God.
Then you shall prosper, if you are careful to perform the statutes and the judgments which the LORD commanded Moses concerning Israel. Be strong and courageous; do not fear and do not be dismayed.

And behold, in my affliction I have prepared for the house of the LORD a hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver; and for bronze and iron there is no weighing, for it was in abundance; and timber and stones I have prepared, and you shall add to them.
And with you are workmen in abundance, hewers and craftsmen of stone and wood, and all manner of skillful men in every kind of work.
Of the gold, the silver, and the bronze, and the iron, there is no number. Arise and do, and may the LORD be with you.
And David commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son.

Is not the LORD your God with you, and has he not given you rest on every side? For he has delivered the inhabitants of the land into my hand, and the land is subdued before the LORD and before his people.

Now set your heart and your soul to seek the LORD your God; and arise, and build the sanctuary of the LORD God, to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and the holy vessels of God, into the house that is to be built for the name of the LORD.
Now David was old and full of days, and he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
And he gathered together all the princes of Israel, and the priests, and the Levites.
And the Levites were numbered, from thirty years old and upward, and their number by their heads, as men, was thirty and eight thousand.
Of these, twenty-four thousand were over the work of the house of the LORD, and six thousand were officers and judges.
and four thousand were gatekeepers, and four thousand were those who praised the LORD with the instruments which I made for giving praise.
And David divided them into divisions according to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
Of the Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei.
The sons of Laadan: the chief Jehiel, and Zetham, and Joel, three.
The sons of Shimei: Shelomith, and Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the heads of the fathers’ houses of Laadan.
And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, and Jeush, and Beriah; these were the sons of Shimei, four.
And Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second; but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, and they became one father’s house for the numbering.
The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.

The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. And Aaron was set apart to sanctify him as most holy, he and his sons forever, to burn incense before the LORD, to minister to Him, and to bless in His name forever.
And Moses the man of God, his sons were called after the tribe of Levi.
The sons of Moses were Gershom and Eliezer.
The sons of Gershom: Shebuel the chief.
And the sons of Eliezer were Rehabiah the chief; and Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were exceedingly many.
The sons of Izhar: Shelomith was the chief.
The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
The sons of Uzziel: Micah the chief, and Isshiah the second.
The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
And Eleazar died, and he had no sons, but only daughters; and the sons of Kish their brothers took them as wives.
The sons of Mushi: Mahli, and Eder, and Jeremoth, three.

These were the sons of Levi, according to their fathers’ houses, the heads of the fathers, by their mustering, in the number of names, by their skulls, those who did the work for the service of the house of the LORD, from twenty years old and upward.
For David said, The LORD, the God of Israel, has given rest to His people, and He dwells in Jerusalem forever.
And also for the Levites, there shall be no more bearing of the tabernacle, nor of all its vessels for its service.
For by the last words of David was this the number of the sons of Levi, from twenty years old and upward.

For their station was at the side of the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of the LORD, over the courts and over the chambers, and over the purifying of all that is holy, and the work of the service of the house of God.

and for the bread of the arrangement, and for the fine flour for the grain offering, and for the unleavened wafers, and for that which is baked on the griddle, and for that which is mixed in the pan, and for all measures of quantity and size.
And to stand every morning, morning by morning, to give thanks and to praise the LORD, and likewise at evening.
and for all the burnt offerings to the LORD, for the sabbaths, for the new moons, and for the appointed times, by number according to the ordinance concerning them, continually before the LORD.
And they shall keep the charge of the Tent of Meeting, and the charge of the sanctuary, and the charge of the sons of Aaron their brothers, for the service of the house of the LORD.
And the divisions of the sons of Aaron were these: the sons of Aaron were Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and they had no sons; and Eleazar and Ithamar ministered as priests.
And David divided them, and Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, according to their offices in their service.

And there were found among the sons of Eleazar more chief men than among the sons of Ithamar; and they divided them thus: to the sons of Eleazar, sixteen heads of fathers’ houses, and to the sons of Ithamar, eight of their fathers’ houses.
And they divided them by lots, these with those; for there were princes of the sanctuary and princes of God, from among the sons of Eleazar and among the sons of Ithamar.

And Shemaiah son of Nethanel the scribe, of the Levites, wrote them before the king and the princes, and Zadok the priest, and Ahimelech son of Abiathar, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and of the Levites: one father’s house being taken for Eleazar, and one taken for Ithamar.
And the first lot came out for Jehoiarib, the second for Jedaiah.
The third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim.
The fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin.
the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah
The ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah.
The eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim.

the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer
for Hezir the seventeenth, for Happizzez the eighteenth.
the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezkel.
the one and twentieth to Jachin, the two and twentieth to Gamul
For Delaiah, the three and twentieth; for Maaziah, the four and twentieth.
These were their appointments for their service, to come into the house of the LORD according to their ordinance, by the hand of Aaron their father, as the LORD, the God of Israel, had commanded him.
And of the sons of Levi who remained: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
For Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, the chief was Isshiah.
Of Izhar: Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth: Jahath.
And the sons of Jeriah: Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
The sons of Uzziel: Micah; for the sons of Micah: Shamir.
The brother of Micah was Isshiah; for the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.
The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi; the sons of Jaaziah, his son.
The sons of Merari: for Jaaziah his son, and Shoham, and Zaccur, and Ibri.
For Mahli: Eleazar; and he had no sons.
To Kish: the sons of Kish was Jerahmeel.
And the sons of Mushi: Mahli, and Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites according to their fathers’ houses.

They also cast lots, just as their brothers the sons of Aaron did, in the presence of David the king, and Zadok, and Ahimelech, and the heads of the fathers’ houses for the priests and for the Levites: the chief fathers, just as his younger brother.

And David and the commanders of the army set apart for the service the sons of Asaph and Heman and Jeduthun, who prophesied with lyres, with harps, and with cymbals; and the number of them, the men of work for their service, was:
Of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, and Joseph, and Nethaniah, and Asarelah, sons of Asaph, under the hand of Asaph, who prophesied under the hand of the king.

Of Jeduthun: the sons of Jeduthun, Gedaliah, Tzeri, Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hand of their father Jeduthun, with the lyre, who prophesied in giving thanks and in praising the LORD.
For Heman: the sons of Heman were Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
All these were the sons of Heman, the seer of the king in the words of God, to lift up the horn. And God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.

All these were under the hand of their father for the song in the house of the LORD, with cymbals, harps, and lyres, for the service of the house of God, under the hand of the king, Asaph, and Jeduthun, and Heman.
And the number of them, with their brothers who were instructed in song for the LORD, all who were skillful, was two hundred eighty-eight.
And they cast lots for the watches, alike for the small as for the great, the skilled together with the learner.
And the first lot came out for Asaph, for Joseph; Gedaliah the second, he and his brothers and his sons, twelve.
The third, Zaccur, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
The fourth to Izri, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
The fifth, Nethaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
The sixth to Bukkiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
The seventh was Jesarelah, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
The eighth, Jeshaiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
The ninth, Mattaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
The tenth was Shimri, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
The eleventh to Azarel, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
The twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
For the thirteenth, Shubael, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
For the fourteenth, Mattithiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
For the fifteenth, to Jeremoth, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
For the sixteenth, to Hananiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve.

For the divisions of the gatekeepers: of the Korahites was Meshelemiah son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
And for Shelemiah, sons were born: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth.
Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.
And to Obed-edom were sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, and Sakar the fourth, and Nethanel the fifth.
Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peullethai the eighth; for God had blessed him.
And to Shemaiah his son were born sons, who ruled over the house of their father, for they were mighty men of valor.
The sons of Shemaiah were Othni, and Rephael, and Obed, Elzabad; his brothers were valiant men, Elihu and Semachiah.
All these were of the sons of Obed-edom; they and their sons and their brothers, men of valor in strength for the service, sixty and two belonging to Obed-edom.
And for Meshelemiah, sons and brothers, men of valor, eighteen in all.
And to Hosah, of the sons of Merari, were sons: Shimri the chief, though he was not the firstborn; yet his father made him chief.
Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth; all the sons and brothers of Hosah were thirteen.
To these belonged the divisions of the gatekeepers, to the chief men as watches corresponding to their brothers, to minister in the house of the LORD.
And they cast lots, the small as well as the great, according to their fathers’ houses, for every gate.
And the lot for the east fell to Shelemiah. And Zechariah his son, a counselor with understanding, cast lots, and his lot came out for the north.
For Obed-edom it fell to the south, and for his sons the storehouse.
For Shuppim and for Hosah, to the west, with the Gate of Shalleketh on the ascending highway, watch by watch opposite to watch.
To the east were Levites six; to the north for each day, four; to the south for each day, four; and for the storehouses, two by two.
For the Parbar on the west, four at the causeway, and two at the Parbar.
These were the divisions of the gatekeepers, for the sons of the Korahite and for the sons of Merari.
And of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasuries of the house of God, and over the treasuries of the holy things.
The sons of Laadan, the sons of the Gershonite belonging to Laadan: the heads of the fathers’ houses of Laadan the Gershonite was Jehieli.
The sons of Jehieli: Zetham and Joel his brother, were over the treasuries of the house of the LORD.
Of the Amramites, of the Izharites, of the Hebronites, of the Uzzielites.
And Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler over the treasuries.
And his brothers by Eliezer were Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.

This Shelomoth and his brothers were over all the treasuries of the holy things which David the king had dedicated, and the heads of the fathers’ houses, the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and the captains of the army.
From the wars and from the spoil they dedicated it, to strengthen the house of the LORD.

And all that Samuel the seer had dedicated, and Saul the son of Kish, and Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah, everyone who dedicated anything, was under the hand of Shelomith and his brothers.
Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were over the outward business for Israel, for officers and for judges.

For the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brothers, men of valor, a thousand and seven hundred, were over the oversight of Israel beyond the Jordan westward, for all the work of the LORD and for the service of the king.

Of the Hebronites, Jeriah was the chief of the Hebronites, according to his generations by fathers. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought out, and there were found among them mighty men of valor at Jazer of Gilead.

And his kinsmen, men of valor, two thousand and seven hundred, heads of fathers’ houses, David the king appointed over the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, for every matter of God and matter of the king.

And the sons of Israel, according to their number, the heads of the fathers’ houses and the commanders of thousands and of hundreds and their officers, who served the king in all matters of the divisions that came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year, each division was twenty-four thousand.
Over the first division for the first month was Jashobeam son of Zabdiel, and over his division were twenty-four thousand.
Of the sons of Perez was the chief of all the captains of the host for the first month.
And over the division of the second month was Dodai the Ahohite, and of his division Mikloth was the chief officer; and over his division were twenty and four thousand.
The third commander of the army for the third month was Benaiah son of Jehoiada the priest, as chief; and in his division were twenty-four thousand.
He is Benaiah, a mighty man of the thirty, and over the thirty; and his division was Ammizabad his son.
The fourth, for the fourth month, was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him; and over his division were twenty and four thousand.
The fifth, for the fifth month, was the commander Shamhuth the Izrahite; and over his division were twenty-four thousand.
The sixth, for the sixth month, was Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite; and over his division were twenty-four thousand.
The seventh, for the seventh month, was Helez the Pelonite, of the sons of Ephraim; and over his division were twenty and four thousand.
The eighth, for the eighth month, was Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zerahites; and in his division were twenty and four thousand.
The ninth, for the ninth month, was Abiezer the Anathothite, of Benjamin; and in his division were twenty and four thousand.
The tenth, for the tenth month, was Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zerahites, and in his division were twenty and four thousand.
The eleventh, for the eleventh month, was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the sons of Ephraim, and over his division were twenty and four thousand.
The twelfth, for the twelfth month, was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel; and over his division were twenty and four thousand.
And over the tribes of Israel: of the Reubenites, the leader was Eliezer son of Zichri; of the Simeonites, Shephatiah son of Maacah.
For Levi, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel; for Aaron, Zadok.

For Zebulun, Ishmaiah son of Obadiah; for Naphtali, Jeremoth son of Azriel.
Over the sons of Ephraim was Hoshea son of Azaziah; over the half-tribe of Manasseh was Joel son of Pedaiah.
For the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah; for Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner.
For Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These were the princes of the tribes of Israel.
And David did not take the number of them from twenty years old and under, for the LORD had said that He would multiply Israel as the stars of the heavens.
Joab son of Zeruiah began to number, but did not finish; and wrath came upon Israel because of this, and the number was not entered in the record of the chronicles of King David.
And over the treasuries of the king was Azmaveth the son of Adiel; and over the storehouses in the field, in the cities, and in the villages, and in the towers was Jonathan the son of Uzziah.
And over those who did the work of the field for the tilling of the ground was Ezri son of Chelub.
And over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite, and over that which was in the vineyards for the treasuries of wine was Zabdi the Shiphmite.
And over the olive trees and the sycamores that were in the lowland was Baal-hanan the Gederite; and over the stores of oil was Joash.
And over the herds that grazed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite; and over the herds in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai.
And over the camels was Obil the Ishmaelite, and over the donkeys was Jehdeiah the Meronothite.
And over the sheep was Jaziz the Hagrite. All these were rulers of the possessions that belonged to King David.
Also Jonathan, David’s uncle, was a counselor, a man of understanding and a scribe; and Jehiel son of Hachmoni was with the sons of the king.
And Ahithophel was counselor to the king, and Hushai the Archite was the king’s friend.
And after Ahithophel came Jehoiada son of Benaiah, and Abiathar; and the commander of the king’s army was Joab.

And David assembled all the princes of Israel, the princes of the tribes, and the captains of the divisions that served the king, and the captains of thousands, and the captains of hundreds, and the captains over all the substance and cattle of the king and of his sons, with the officers and the mighty men, even every mighty man of valor, to Jerusalem.

Then King David rose to his feet and said, Hear me, my brothers and my people: I had it in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and for the footstool of our God, and I made preparations for building.
But God said to me, You shall not build a house for My name, for you are a man of wars, and you have shed blood.

Yet the LORD, the God of Israel, chose me out of all my father’s house to be king over Israel forever; for Judah He chose to be ruler, and in the house of Judah, the house of my father; and among the sons of my father He took pleasure in me, to make me king over all Israel.
And of all my sons—for the LORD has given me many sons—He has chosen Solomon my son to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the LORD over Israel.
And He said to me, “Solomon your son, he shall build My house and My courts, for I have chosen him to be a son to Me, and I will be a Father to him.”
And I will establish his kingdom forever, if he is strong to perform My commandments and My judgments, as at this day.

And now, in the sight of all Israel, the assembly of the LORD, and in the hearing of our God, keep and seek all the commandments of the LORD your God, that you may possess the good land and leave it as an inheritance to your children after you forever.

And you, Solomon my son, know the God of your father and serve Him with a whole heart and with a willing soul; for the LORD searches all hearts and understands every intent of the thoughts. If you seek Him, He will be found by you; but if you forsake Him, He will cast you off forever.
See now, for the LORD has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary; be strong, and do it.
Then David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the porch, and of its houses, and of its treasuries, and of its upper rooms, and of its inner chambers, and of the house of the mercy seat.

And the pattern of all that was in the spirit with him, for the courts of the house of the LORD, and for all the chambers round about, for the treasuries of the house of God, and for the treasuries of the holy things.
and for the divisions of the priests and the Levites, and for all the work of the service of the house of the LORD, and for all the vessels of the service of the house of the LORD.
For the gold, by weight for the gold, for all the vessels of every kind of service; and for all the vessels of silver, by weight for all the vessels of every kind of service.

and the weight of gold for the lampstands of gold and their lamps, of gold, by the weight of each lampstand and its lamps; and for the lampstands of silver, by weight for a lampstand and its lamps, according to the service of each lampstand and lampstand.
And the gold by weight for the tables of the rows, for each table and table, and silver for the tables of silver.
and the forks, and the bowls, and the cups of pure gold; and for the golden bowls, by weight for each bowl and each bowl; and for the silver bowls, by weight for each bowl and each bowl.
and for the altar of incense, refined gold by weight, and for the pattern of the chariot, the cherubim of gold, spreading out and overshadowing the ark of the covenant of the LORD.
All this, said he, is in writing from the hand of the LORD upon me; he gave me understanding in all the works of the pattern.

And David said to Solomon his son, Be strong and courageous, and do it; do not fear, nor be dismayed, for the LORD God, my God, is with you. He will not fail you nor forsake you, until you have finished all the work for the service of the house of the LORD.

And behold, the divisions of the priests and the Levites are for all the service of the house of God; and with you in every work will be every willing one skilled in wisdom for every kind of service, and the princes and all the people will be wholly at your command.
And King David said to all the assembly, “Solomon my son, the one whom God alone has chosen, is young and tender, and the work is great; for the palace is not for man, but for the LORD God.”

And according to all my power I have prepared for the house of my God: the gold for what is of gold, and the silver for what is of silver, and the bronze for what is of bronze, the iron for what is of iron, and the wood for what is of wood; onyx stones and stones for settings, stones of antimony and of variegated colors, and every kind of precious stone, and marble stones in abundance.
Moreover, because I delight in the house of my God, I have a treasure of my own, gold and silver; I give it to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house.
three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, for overlaying the walls of the houses.
for the gold, gold, and for the silver, silver, and for all the work of the craftsmen. And who is willing to offer himself today, to fill his hand for the LORD?
Then the chiefs of the fathers, and the princes of the tribes of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the officers over the king’s work, offered themselves willingly.

And they gave for the service of the house of God gold five thousand talents and ten thousand darics, and silver ten thousand talents, and bronze eighteen thousand talents, and iron one hundred thousand talents.
And whoever was found with precious stones gave them to the treasury of the house of the LORD, into the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
Then the people rejoiced, because they had offered willingly, for with a whole heart they had made their freewill offering to the LORD; and David the king also rejoiced with great joy.
And David blessed the LORD in the sight of all the assembly, and David said, Blessed are You, O LORD, God of Israel our father, from everlasting to everlasting.

Yours, O LORD, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the victory and the majesty; for all that is in the heavens and in the earth is Yours. Yours, O LORD, is the kingdom, and You are exalted as head over all.
Both riches and honor are from before you, and you rule over all; and in your hand are power and might, and in your hand it is to make great and to strengthen all.
And now, our God, we give thanks to You and praise the name of Your glory.
For who am I, and who are my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly as this? For all is from You, and from Your hand we have given to You.
For we are strangers before you and sojourners, as all our fathers were; our days on the earth are like a shadow, and there is no hope.
O LORD our God, all this abundance that we have prepared to build for you a house for your holy name is from your hand, and all belongs to you.

And I know, O my God, that you try the heart and take pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of my heart I have willingly offered all these things; and now I have seen your people, who are found here, offering willingly to you with joy.
O LORD, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our fathers, keep this forever in the imagination of the thoughts of the heart of Your people, and direct their heart toward You.
And to Solomon my son give a whole heart, to keep Your commandments, Your testimonies, and Your statutes, and to perform all this, and to build the fortress for which I have made provision.

And David said to all the assembly, “Now bless the LORD your God.” And all the assembly blessed the LORD, the God of their fathers, and they bowed their heads and prostrated themselves before the LORD and before the king.

And they sacrificed sacrifices to the LORD and offered burnt offerings to the LORD on the next day after that day, a thousand bulls, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their drink offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.

And they ate and drank before the LORD on that day with great gladness, and they made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed him for the LORD to be prince, and Zadok to be priest.
Then Solomon sat upon the throne of the LORD as king in place of David his father, and he prospered, and all Israel listened to him.
And all the princes and the mighty men, and likewise all the sons of King David, gave their hand under Solomon the king.
And the LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and bestowed upon him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him over Israel.
And David son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
And the days that he reigned over Israel were forty years; in Hebron he reigned seven years, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty and three.
And he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor; and Solomon his son reigned in his place.
Now the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the words of Samuel the seer, and in the words of Nathan the prophet, and in the words of Gad the seer.
Together with all his reign and his might, and the times that passed over him, and over Israel, and over all the kingdoms of the lands.
